senses.sense_definition: A leash or strap used for leading an animal.

examples.text: The trainer clipped the <w>leadline</w> onto the pony's bridle before walking it out.
You must hold the <w>leadline</w> firmly to keep the dog under control.

senses.sense_definition: A line with a weight at one end used in navigation to determine water depth.

examples.text: The sailor lowered the <w>leadline</w> over the side to check the channel's depth.
Before modern sonar, a <w>leadline</w> was essential for avoiding shallow waters.

senses.sense_definition: A weighted rope attached to the bottom edge of a fishing net to keep it submerged.

examples.text: Weights on the <w>leadline</w> ensure the net sinks quickly to the riverbed.
The fishermen repaired the damaged <w>leadline</w> after it snagged on a rock.
